column1: #Text=[0059] In step 525, a test is performed to determine whether the trigger switch on the handheld head has been pressed.

#Text=If the trigger switch has not been pressed, the system will not attempt to read the barcode or other symbol or indicia using a flying-spot scan, and control returns to step 522 so that another attempt can be made using an imaging read.
#Text=The test of step 525 may be included for safety reasons, to prevent, for example, the unintentional discharge of laser light.

#Text=[0060] If the test of step 525 determines that the trigger has been pressed, control then passes to step 526, where the controller 300 adjusts the parameters for the upcoming flying-spot scan, preferably based on previously performed flying-spot scans.
#Text=These parameters may include, for example, the speed of the scanning spot.
#Text=Next, in step 527, the system attempts to read the target barcode using a flying-spot scan.
#Text=Details of implementing this step (including, for example, reading and decoding the edge data) have been described previously herein.
#Text=[0061] Next, in step 528, a test is performed to determine whether the attempted read (in step 527) was successful.
#Text=If the attempted read was successful, processing continues in step 529, where the data corresponding to the target barcode or other symbol or indicia is reported.
#Text=If, on the other hand, the attempted read in step 527 was not successful, processing returns to step 522, which is the start of the imaging reading routine.
#Text=This process is repeated to effectuate reading of the bar code, symbol or other indicia.
#Text=[0062] A number of variations to the program depicted in FIG. 3 will be apparent to those skilled in the art upon review of the specification, drawings and claims herein.

#Text=For example, instead of switching between the imaging and flying-spot reading modes after each unsuccessful reading attempt, the system may remain in either of those modes until a predetermined number of unsuccessful reading attempts have occurred.

#Text=[0063] In another embodiment, the integrated optical reader 90 alternates between reading with the flying-spot front end 100 and the imaging front end 200, and performs data capture using one reading method in parallel with decoding data gathered using a different reading method.
